intro: Guatteria stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a fragrant aroma, and it produces edible, fleshy berries that are often consumed by various wildlife species. Guatteria stenocarpa plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and supporting local ecosystems.
